TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesday: A week of Experimental Testing

Articles.Content:
Calm down guys, as I understand it, the turbine is purely for aesthetic purpose. It don't seen to have collider (clip thru part) so it won't change how the engine is handled, so for the stock VTOLers, the hard par will be to hide this hideous stuff.

But even tho i like it, I can't deny that it does serve no real purpose, a part from the educational value of it.

Edited November 4, 2015 by Hary R

Tweakable would certainly be fine, if you can do that. I've never seen a tweakable turn off part of a model. But then again, I don't really know how that stuff works. However, if you made it tweakable, you could just make it disappear after it is attached to the node and reappear when it gets taken back off the node, those who want it there wouldn't be able to tell the difference anyway, because it doesn't do anything.
I've actually seen lots of mods that do both. For example the tanks in SpaceY have an "end cap" that automatically appears when you attach a part on top of them. So it's 100% possible.
Think about it really, really hard. Would you actually prefer a dedicated, invisible, intractable "turbine" part?
IMHO that could actually work. The turbine takes in fuel and intake air and produces "Exhaust". Jet nozzles use exhaust to make thrust. Some new RCS parts could use exhaust too, to emulate how the Harrier uses bleed air jets.

Would it be the best way? Not sure - it would permit new design oddities. But I think it would basically work.

I REALLY dig the new turbines but all you people are mixed so why don't we have a "Procedural Turbine"

in most basic term the turbine is lengthened to shortened to match the size of the fuel tank its placed on, but Only for fuel tanks. so you can use that quarter sized tank to hide it while its still a thing that looks cool
All I have to say regarding the new jet engine: For years they told us part clipping could be bad stuff!

also:

since we have new buoyancy.. new water effects.. isn't also needed a BAB (Boat Assembly Building) and a SLS (Sea Launching Site)

Jesus, so much negativity.. I'm pretty excited about everything here, the jet, the underwater fog, the flight log using actual part title, toggleable decouplers, better exhaust textures, and cute behaviour... All sounds great!

I don't build VTOLS, but is it so hard to put the engine at the end of a fuel tank or fuselage? See Cupcakes latest video for an example.

That said, I'm not against using ModuleJettison to make the model appear when stack attached, but not when radially attached. Everybody wins - VTOLers get magic place-anywhere nozzles that somehow produce thrust, everyone else gets a jet engine that makes sense.

Edited November 4, 2015 by ObsessedWithKSP

To be honest, yeah, I'm on the "not sure" bandwagon. I don't really know what to feel - I mean, after all, it is potentially pleasing and could explain offset CoM a lot for the engines, but just.. it would make a lot of designs such as VTOLS ugly. Not to mention, what about designs that have engines mounted on short fuselages, or in pods?

- - - Updated - - -

Jesus, so much negativity..

I don't build VTOLS, but is it so hard to put the engine at the end of a fuel tank or fuselage? See Cupcakes latest video for an example.

That said, I'm not against using ModuleJettison to make the model appear when stack attached, but not when radially attached. Everybody wins - VTOLers get magic place-anywhere nozzles that somehow produce thrust, everyone else gets a jet engine that makes sense.

There is a difference between "negativity" and providing thoughts and feedback on new things. It's not as if everyone's bashing Squad.

Regarding turbines and VTOL. If its a module in the config file then whats the problem? Just add the module to the VTOL engine part in the cfg file. It will be there but invisible to the eye. VTOL and realism both win. I dont see a problem with turbines at all

There is a difference between "negativity" and providing thoughts and feedback on new things.

And in this case, there was both. Yes, a bit of constructive criticism here and there, but way more 'I don't like this, it's rubbish and kills everything' kind of posts with no other help or actual ways to improve it beyond not changing it in the first place.
Little Easter Eggs contract awards.... Outstanding!!!

let there be awesome!

cant wait! cant wait! cant wait! cant wait! cant wait!

COM offset on the turbines.this explaines everything.

Regarding turbines and VTOL. If its a module in the config file then whats the problem? Just add the module to the VTOL engine part in the cfg file. It will be there but invisible to the eye. VTOL and realism both win. I dont see a problem with turbines at all

That would make VTOLs non stock and so harder to share. I think the problem could be entirely avoided if the turbine vanished on attachment to anything - outside the editor, why would anybody need to see it? It'd either be hidden anyway, or getting in the way.

As it is now, it looks like just another nail in the VTOL coffin.
I need the update ^^

Also its not just vtols that will have issues, what about having engines mounted on the fat end of nosecones and tail connectors, which I've seen used and have used myself a lot.Now the turbines will clip through. Although it's a nice change in some situations, it's also ruining a lot of other design options, and IMO doing more harm than good.
Considering the hot debate on the jet engines, I suggest creating a discussion thread in the development discussions forum instead of making this thread focus on one small part of the devnotes.
Jet engine discussion thread here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138338-The-new-longer-jet-engine-models

also:

since we have new buoyancy.. new water effects.. isn't also needed a BAB (Boat Assembly Building) and a SLS (Sea Launching Site)

I don't know about the BAB, but for the prequel (Kerbal Aeronautic Program) and for plane lovers, an SLS could be a welcome addition.

Ok, let me reframe my question about ragdolling, Kasper:

-Why do KSP has ragdolling mechanics that don't allow the players to recover control until the Kerbal in question imobilizes ( or gets a small enough velocity ) in the ground? Given that we have bodies in game with very little gravity, waiting that the kerbal imobilizes in the ground to give back control to the player is not the best way to deal with things, and in fact half of the issue with the female kerbals ragdolling is not the extra elasticity in itself, but the fact that, due to the extra elasticity, your female kerbal will simply not stop for a long, long time ( and sometimes will not stop before they reach kerbal breaking velocities ) and thus you will not regain control in a while, if ever :/

This, it should be an minimum velocity then you impact or rater an knock out time based on velocity. Part of the problem is kerbals ragdoll then they drop ladders

- - - Updated - - -

Well, I like when things are technically correct. The turbines are a nice thought, but I think it's a bad idea to add them in terms of flexibility. It works for the typical designs, but in some cases you might pretend that nozzle and turbine are built at an angle.

Everything else i think is absolutely great!

Also, I actually think it is great that you go ahead and try the thing with the turbines and see how it looks, how people react.

Is the turbines on all the engines or just the higher performance ones, the basic jet engine would be better suited to low speed vtol operations I think.

Jesus? Did I miss a joke?

Oh, Squad is based in Mexico. I'm a moron.

As it is now, it looks like just another nail in the VTOL coffin.
